summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganNaturium's Vitamin Bright Illuminating Eye Cream provides nourishing hydration to the eye area. Formulated with a 2% vitamin K liposome complex and light-reflecting pearl pigments, Vitamin Bright reduces the appearance of dark circles, providing instant brightness & a luminous finish.
details: DetailsBenefitsFormulated with naturally derived, light-reflecting mineral pigments to brighten eye areaâ€‹Helps reduce the appearance of dark circles instantly & over timeâ€‹Moisturizes & blurs fine lines & wrinklesDermatologist testedFragrance freeVegan, paraben & cruelty freeFeaturesThis luminous, nourishing eye cream provides just a hint of tint with pearlized, illuminating pigmentsEach shade is flexible, buildable, and created to work on a wide variety of skin tonesVitamin Bright helps increase brightness under the eyes or works as a brightening eye primer, before concealerPro tip: Formula creates a cushion-soft base for flawless makeup applicationKey Ingredients2% Vitamin K Liposome: helps reduce the appearance of dark circles over time, helps to improve appearance of under-eye skin tone, for a brighter look; a potent antioxidant that helps protect against free radicals caused by environmental stressorsPhyto-Complex: works to decrease appearance of redness, soothes for an immediate skin calming effectBrightening Pearl Pigments: light reflecting pigments instantly color correct & brighten the under eye, helps provide an immediate natural radianceShea Butter: boosts skin moisture, helps soothe and condition skin, leaving it soft, supple, & nourishedItem 2627349How To UseUsing ring finger, gently tap around entire eye area morning and night.For external use only. Use only as directed.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Glycerin, Candelilla/Jojoba/Rice Bran Polyglyceryl-3 Esters, Dimethicone, Isododecane, Acetyl Ethylhexyl Polyhydroxystearate, Glyceryl Stearate, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Stearyl Alcohol, Butylene Glycol, Cetearyl Alcohol, Phytonadione, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Phospholipids, Melia Azadirachta Flower Extract, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Bran Extract, Ocimum Sanctum Leaf Extract, Sorbitan Oleate, Melia Azadirachta Leaf Extract, Algin, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice Powder, Cellulose, Sodium Phytate, Escin, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract, Ocimum Basilicum (Basil) Flower/Leaf Extract, Corallina Officinalis Extract, Ruscus Aculeatus Root Extract, Ammonium Glycyrrhizate, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Extract, Centella Asiatica Extract, Hydrolyzed Yeast Protein, Calendula Officinalis Flower Extract, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Tocopherol, Isopropyl Titanium Triisostearate, Panthenol, Caprylyl/Capryl Glucoside, Sodium Stearoyl Lactylate, Ammonium Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Sodium Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate, HDI/Trimethylol Hexyllactone Crosspolymer, Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Hydroxyacetophenone, Polyisobutene, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Cetyl Alcohol, Citric Acid, Sodium Citrate, Mica, Tin Oxide, Phenoxyethanol, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491).
how_to_use: Using ring finger, gently tap around entire eye area morning and night.For external use only. Use only as directed.

reviews.headline: love!
reviews.comments: the reviews make this product seem sketchy but i tried and maybe i'm delusional but i saw a difference! i personally love it. this product is great for brightening when you don't want to wear concealer!

reviews.headline: Naturium eye brightening cream in light-medium
reviews.comments: I agree with most of the other negative reviews about this product. my skin is more light than medium so the banana color should have brightened my under eye area but it didn't, like others it just disappeared. then when I put it on it was thick, shiny, and pilled under my makeup. I never used this as a concealer or color corrector, so maybe layering all this products on top didn't agree with the cream, but when I used it alone while sleeping, if I rubbed my eye, which when using this product happened a lot, it just rolled up in balls and flaked off.  not good in my opinion. I feel that after an hour of wearing it should absorb. I think they wanted this product to brighten and "blur" but it doesn't, it just pills horribly with any pressure when applying makeup or touching your under eye area.

reviews.headline: Love this!
reviews.comments: This is the best! Its like adding your highlight and eyecream at the same time. I don't wear makeup, so this is perfect for the discoloration under my eyes when I dont sleep well.

reviews.headline: I like it
reviews.comments: I'm a middle-aged woman with combo skin and sun damage. I had eczema under my left eye for the longest time. I've been to the dermatologist numerous times but nothing helped. until this. I bought it because I saw a TikTok and figured, "Why not?", and I'm very glad I did. I love this stuff. it's very moisturizing and clean. it gives a bit of shimmer to help with my undereye bags. I'll keep buying it unless the recipe changes. I also have the facial lotion with sunscreen, but that's a different review.

reviews.headline: Not great
reviews.comments: No results. Was super thick and hard to work in.

reviews.headline: Not great
reviews.comments: No results. Was super thick and hard to work in.

reviews.headline: Doesn't do much for me
reviews.comments: I was hoping this would be somewhat of a dupe for the ole henricksen banana bright eye creamâ€¦but just doesn't compare. And its sparkly?

reviews.headline: Good so far!
reviews.comments: I like this so far! I did get a milia under my eye after using but that often happens to me with thicker eye creams. I do think it makes my dark circles look better

reviews.headline: Skip
reviews.comments: The consistency is strange and the "glow" that it leaves behind doesnt cover up anything but does leave a glittery finish that does not look attractive, if anything it made by dark circles stand out more ðŸ˜‚

reviews.headline: Creamy eye cream
reviews.comments: Love the consistency of this eye cream and that it can be applied all around the eyes. It also seems to provide a very slight brightening effect for my dark circles immediately. I am hoping it will provide long term brightening effects with consistent use.

reviews.headline: Made it worst
reviews.comments: My under eyes used to never be bad until I started using this product, it literally made it worse and wasn't very moisturizing. Also, the color would just disappear.

reviews.headline: Pretty good
reviews.comments: I usually have issues with eye creams but this one has played well with my other skincare and doesnt irritate my skin like a lot of other eye creams do. I dont see any color correcting or anything but it is hydrating

reviews.headline: Very Hydrating
reviews.comments: If you have dry under eyes, this is a must! Its very hydrating and feels luxurious. I was previously using the It Cosmetics Confidence In An Eye Cream and made the switch to this. The tint is more of a pearl-like reflector that makes my dark circles less noticeable. Again, the tint doesn't conceal my dark circles completely, but it does tone down the darkness a bit. I think this is a great product and you cannot beat the price point.

reviews.headline: Extremely disappointing!
reviews.comments: Very irritating to eyes. Very strange consistency, watery. And what was the color about? Did nothing! Disappointing as it sounded like air would be a good product!

reviews.headline: Not good for under makeup
reviews.comments: I want to replace my go to eyecream Origins and thought this would be a good replacement. I noticed when I first opened it looked used already. I applied some on my under eyes at night to see if it would be good for under makeup and immediately no, its thick and doesn't absorb I also didnt notice any brightening effect like I do with Origins. When I woke up I had tiny break outs around my eyes so now I have to try and repair that. Not worth it.

reviews.headline: Good eye cream
reviews.comments: I found this to be brightening and very hydrating for my under eyes. It is on the richer side for an eye cream, not extremely rich but definitely not a watery thin formula. It worked well under makeup for me. My undereyes are not very dry so I typically use a thin eye cream (such as the Inkey List eye creams) under makeup, but this worked as well. Would be excellent for people with dry undereyes! Really does brighten too, the tint is as pictured, and has extremely fine shimmer in the formula to add to the brightening effect. Not noticeable unless you get super close to the face.

reviews.headline: pretty good.
reviews.comments: these products as helped my circulation and reduced my dark circles I got from work, as far as the pigments it dosent really cover them, but it makes them reflective so it's less noticeable. but the vitman k Has really reduced them alot.

reviews.headline: Oily film made product unusable
reviews.comments: I really wanted to love this product as it seemed like it could be a dupe for the more expensive Ole Henriksen eye cream. I used it a few times and it was fine. I didnt really notice any dofference bewtween when I used it or didnt. However, after just a few uses the  textire started to change. It became oily, and goopy. A clear oily liquid had seperated from the orange cream and sat on top of the product. I tries mixing it back together but it continued to seperate. I havent been brave enough to use it again

media.headline: Burned my skin. Very painful
media.caption: Painful burn & welt after immediate use

faceoff_positive.comments: I sit on the tail end of medium-light, sometimes (depending on the brand) I'm labeled medium when it comes to foundation. I have a cool undertone, and I would say this cream in the medium/deep shade is perfect for me. I'm mixed race, I have very dry, sensitive skin. I suffer with eczema, pretty severe post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation in the eye area, and I have very narrow deep-set eyes that extenuate the discoloration. This product looks beautiful. It helps reduce the appearance of the hyperpigmentation, and I've been able to use it in place of hydrocortisone ointment I was using to treat the eczema. My eyes never feel dry, and the moisture lasts all day as long as I don't wipe or wash it away. I've purchased it twice now. It lays beautifully under makeup. It's easy to use, and you don't need a lot to get great results. I've only been using it for close to 3 months now. I don't currently notice any fading of the discoloration itself, but I think the factors I've listed previously would make that a pretty impossible expectation to meet for a skincare product. Especially considering that I haven't used it that long. So I can't speak to long term effects. If I have the ability to update this review, I would gladly share more about the effects of long term use, but for now I'm really happy with my purchase.
faceoff_positive.headline: I love this product

faceoff_negative.comments: Each time I've used the vitamin bright eye cream, my skin has burned.. quite painfully. I thought it would be temporary, but this last time, it made a red swollen welt under my eye. It's safe to say I gave it a fair try. I must be allergic or something in it isn't good for my skin.
faceoff_negative.headline: Burned my skin. Very painful
